snippet: The truce, which has drawn skepticism, led to a reduction of violence in its early hours, but there were some reported violations by both sides....
abstract: Cease-fire negotiated by American and Russian governments in Syrian civil war goes into effect; within hours, opposition forces report violations by government forces, but many hold out hope initial calm of cease-fire will prevail.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Maher Samaan from Paris, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The truce, which has drawn skepticism, led to a reduction of violence in its early hours, but there were some reported violations by both sides.

headline.main: Syria Is Calmer but Cautious as Cease-Fire Begins
headline.print_headline: Syria Is Calmer but Cautious as Cease-Fire Begins

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
